metadata.title: CVE-2021-37959 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in Task Manager in Google Chrome prior to 94.0.4606.54allowed an attacker who convinced a user to enage in a series of usergestures to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37959` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '94.0.4606.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
